de.lambeck.pned.elements.gui

Class GuiArc

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lambeck.pned.elements.gui.GuiElement
      • de.lambeck.pned.elements.gui.GuiArc
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGuiArc, IGuiElement, IHasZValue, IPaintable, ISelectable, IArc, IElement, java.io.Serializable

    public class GuiArc
extends GuiElement
implements IGuiArc
    Implements the arcs (arrows) of the Petri net.
    Author:
    Thomas Lambeck, 4128320
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GuiArc

        public GuiArc(java.lang.String id,
              int zValue,
              IGuiNode source,
              IGuiNode target)
       throws PNElementCreationException
        Constructor with parameters for target and source. Makes sure that the arc always connects a place and a transition.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of this Arc
        zValue - The height level
        source - The source id
        target - The target id
        Throws:
        PNElementCreationException - For an invalid combination of source and target

    • Method Detail

      • getShapeSize

        public static int getShapeSize()
        Returns the size of all shapes (static attribute).

        Note: Used for drawing the (temporary) arc on the "draw new arc" overlay.
        Returns:
        The current shape size

      • changeShapeSize

        public static void changeShapeSize(int size)
        Changes the size of all shapes (static attribute). Calculates a smaller value to make arcs smaller than the nodes!
        Parameters:
        size - The new size

      • activateAntialiasing

        private void activateAntialiasing(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
        Activates anti-aliasing for the specified Graphics2D context.
        Parameters:
        g2 - The specified Graphics2D context

      • getStartAnchor

        private java.awt.Point getStartAnchor()
        Returns the start point of this arc determined by the predecessor (GuiPlace or GuiTransition respectively).
        Returns:
        A Point as start anchor; null if distance between start and end is zero

      • getEndAnchor

        private java.awt.Point getEndAnchor()
        Returns the end point of this arc determined by the successor (GuiPlace or GuiTransition respectively).
        Returns:
        A Point as end anchor; null if distance between start and end is zero

      • highlightAnchors

        private void highlightAnchors(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                              java.awt.Point startAnchor,
                              java.awt.Point endAnchor)
        Highlights the arc anchors with a small circle when debug is true.
        Parameters:
        g2 - The Graphics2D object
        startAnchor - The start anchor
        endAnchor - The start anchor

      • drawArrowLine

        private void drawArrowLine(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                           java.awt.Point startAnchor,
                           java.awt.Point endAnchor)
        Draws the line of the arrow from and to the anchors on two IGuiNode.

        Note: IGuiNode provide their anchor for a specified direction via Getter method.
        Parameters:
        g2 - The Graphics2D context
        startAnchor - The location of the anchor at the source node as Point
        endAnchor - The location of the anchor at the target node as Point

      • getArrowLine

        private java.awt.geom.Line2D.Double getArrowLine(java.awt.Point startAnchor,
                                                 java.awt.Point endAnchor)
        Returns the line of the arrow for use in drawArrowLine() and contains().
        Parameters:
        startAnchor - The location of the anchor at the source node as Point
        endAnchor - The location of the anchor at the target node as Point
        Returns:
        A Line2D.Double

      • drawArrowTip

        private void drawArrowTip(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                          java.awt.Point startAnchor,
                          java.awt.Point endAnchor)
        Draws the tip of the arrow.

        Note: IGuiNode provide their anchor for a specified direction via Getter method.
        Parameters:
        g2 - The Graphics2D context
        startAnchor - The location of the anchor at the source node as Point
        endAnchor - The location of the anchor at the target node as Point

      • getArrowHead

        private java.awt.Polygon getArrowHead(java.awt.Point startAnchor,
                                      java.awt.Point endAnchor)
        Returns an arrow head for an arrow that is specified by start point and end point.

        Note: Start point (source) and end point (target) need to be determined by predecessor and successor (GuiPlace or GuiTransition respectively).
        Parameters:
        startAnchor - The source of the arrow
        endAnchor - The target of the arrow (with the arrow head)
        Returns:
        A polygon representing the arrow head

      • drawSelection

        private void drawSelection(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                           java.awt.Point startAnchor,
                           java.awt.Point endAnchor)
        Indicates the selection of this Arc.
        Parameters:
        g2 - The Graphics2D object
        startAnchor - The Location where the arc starts as Point
        endAnchor - The Location where the arc ends as Point

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.awt.Point p)
        Description copied from interface: IGuiElement
        Checks if a Point is within the shape.

        Note that this refers to the shape of this node itself (place, transition) only. It does not take the area of the label into account!
        Specified by:
        contains in interface IGuiElement
        Parameters:
        p - the Point to check
        Returns:
        true if the Point is within the shape

      • getPredElem

        public IGuiNode getPredElem()
                     throws PNNoSuchElementException
        Description copied from interface: IGuiArc
        This method returns the predecessor (the "start") of the arc.

        Note: Throws a PNNoSuchElementException if predecessor is null because per definition a IGuiArc has a predecessor at any time.
        Specified by:
        getPredElem in interface IGuiArc
        Returns:
        The predecessor
        Throws:
        PNNoSuchElementException - if predecessor is null

      • getSuccElem

        public IGuiNode getSuccElem()
                     throws PNNoSuchElementException
        Description copied from interface: IGuiArc
        This method returns the successor (the "end") of the arc.

        Note: Throws a PNNoSuchElementException if successor is null because per definition a IGuiArc has a successor at any time.
        Specified by:
        getSuccElem in interface IGuiArc
        Returns:
        The successor
        Throws:
        PNNoSuchElementException - if successor is null
